message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a method for training a deterministic deep model that can find and reject out of distribution data points at test time with a single forward pass. This falls under the category of uncertainty estimation in deep learning, which is a popular research area in machine learning. The paper also mentions the use of gradient penalty, which is a technique commonly used in adversarial training, indicating a possible connection to the sub-category of adversarial machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also deals with image datasets such as FashionMNIST, CIFAR-10, and SVHN, indicating a possible connection to the sub-categories of computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL). Finally, the paper proposes a novel loss function and centroid updating scheme, indicating a possible connection to the sub-category of neural networks (cs.NE) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
